page.title: 03Conservation in Uxbridge
page.content: This part of Hilingdon is a mixture of old and new,as Uxbridge was once a market town.Much of Windsor st is conserved,the police lamp, post office,sweet shop and the Queens Head which dates back to 1544.The High Streets Falcon Inn,Bank House,Barclays Bank,the Three Tuns and Cedars an 18th century house and the Nonna Rosa restaurant are conserved.Saint Margarets church is the oldest building in Uxbridge,built before 1248.Saint Johns church is 700 years old.There are old houses like the Crown and Treaty,Swakeleys and the Old Mill on Oxford road.The Market House is being restored while the Art Deco Regal cinema is now a nightclub.The tower on the Civic Centre is from the Market House.Uxbridge underground station has been conserved too.
